translated: Elder’s Birth Stories🔽. The Chapter with Tinnidāyaka, etc.
“Having gone out from my day-resting place,
Vipassī, the Leader of the World,
having quickly given a fine cloth,
for an eon I rejoiced in heaven.
I do not know of a bad destination,
this is the fruit of the fine cloth.
I have done what the Awakened One said.
I have done what the Awakened One said.”🔽Thus the elder Supaṭadāyaka recited these verses.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā supaṭadāyako thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Supaṭadāyakattherassāpadānaṁ pañcamaṁ.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā supaṭadāyakaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati 🔽supaṭadāyaka therassa apadānam pañcama
translated: The Elder Supaṭadāyaka’s Birth Story is the fifth.
